{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of a wound that developed into a bluish plaque with a central area of necrosis surrounded by a rim of erythema are indicative of a bite from a brown recluse spider. This spider is known to cause necrotic skin lesions that can be painful and cause systemic symptoms. The other options listed do not typically cause these types of symptoms. Diamondback rattlesnakes cause severe pain, swelling, and systemic symptoms but not necrotic skin lesions. Striped bark scorpions cause severe pain and systemic neurologic symptoms but not skin necrosis. Deer ticks can cause Lyme disease, which presents with erythema migrans, a rash that does not cause necrosis.", "answer_choice": "B. Brown recluse spider"}
